CatDescriptText: Mr. Marshall Johnson, postal worker, 1104 Larimer Avenue, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 11, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that students are getting adequate vocational counseling in the schools these days? Do you have any suggestions for increasing or improving it?" answer reads: "I personally feel that the counseling could be developed to a greater efficiency in city schools.  They could pattern the counseling services after the outstanding ones in other large cities.  I feel that the school system does not have adequate facilities for good counseling service.  There is a lack of personnel."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Marshall Johnson wearing dark suit jacket with lapel pin and light colored pocket scarf monogrammed "M", standing under Jenkins Arcade marquee, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
